result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian Timothy Orosz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christian Timothy Orosz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christian Timothy Orosz was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Matthew L Hartung, Christian Timothy Orosz pro se. Cas called at 2:36 pm. Def and ADA Hartung have spoken. Def is ready to proceed. Ct finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives counsel and is competent to represent himself. ADA Hartung gives recommendation. Court orders on count 2: S/W 6 months probation with conditions: 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety 
- Court costs $243.00
- Def to comply with domestic abuse assessment at probation agent request. 
Def notified of right to appeal.
Plea hearing at 10-15-2015 02:30 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung. Christian Timothy Orosz pro se. Case called at 11:47. Court reviews file. ADA Hartung updates the court and gives recommendation. DE waives counsel. Court finds the DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives counsel. 

  Plea hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
per court order. gme
Motion hearing at 10-15-2015 11:30 am

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung, NONA by def. Case called at 8:21. Hall has been called. Scheduled for a motion hearing. Court reviews file. Atty. Gherty no longer represents DE. There is an affidavit of mailing for DE on Sept. 4. Court finds there has been service. Court finds there is a basis to revoke and enter conviction for DC.

Case recalled at 9:10 with DE present. ADA Nieskes appeared.   QUASH WARRANT. Address confirmed. ADA Nieskes updates the court. DE would like the MH rescheduled because he is not represented.
Filed by Atty Gherty. He has not been retained on file. km
to Revoke Diversion Agreement. Filed by ADA Hartung. km
Count 2 - all parties signed this date. c: DA. eif
Def & Atty signed this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Matthew Hartung. DF ATTY: Mark J Gherty DF: Christian Timothy Orosz appeared. Case called at 3:03. Atty Gherty updates the court, there is a diversion agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC  to Ct 2 in 15CM192 removing the domestic abuse inhancer. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Atty's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 15CM192 removing the domestic abuse inhancer. Court withholds the entry of conviction. Court signs the diversion agreement. Diversion program to give quartley updates to the court. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CM192. Bond continues.
Filed by ADA Hartung. km
Status conference on July 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, T. Orosz.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
